main.head: Mario Monti unveils new Italian government - video
main.p: This article is more than 13 years old

Italy's recently appointed prime minister, Mario Monti, reveals his government of technocrats, telling the president, Giorgio Napolitano, he is ready to test its support in parliament. Monti said he would also serve as the finance minister, and handed the industry and infrastructure portfolios to Corrado Passera, the CEO of Italy's biggest retail bank, Intesa Sanpaolo
